section.title: Usage information
section.p: Because the navtitle element is available within topicmeta, a navtitle element might occur in contexts where a navigation title does not make sense, for example, on a topicgroup element. In those situations, the navtitle element has no defined purpose.

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p: When the navtitle element is used in a topic, processors SHOULD use the contents of the element to generate the navigation title.
When the navtitle element is used in a map, processors SHOULD retrieve the navigation title in the following order:

ol.li: From the content of a navtitle element in the map, if the containing topicref element sets the value of the locktitle attribute to "yes"
From the contents of a navtitle element in the referenced topic
From the title of the referenced topic

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: .

fig.title: navtitle in a topic
fig.p: In the following example, the navtitle element is used in a topic. It contains a shorter title that will be used in a TOC or navigation pane when the topic is published.
fig.codeblock: <task id="publishing-dita"> <title>Publishing a DITA information set in PDF</title> <titlealts> <navtitle>Publishing in PDF</navtitle> </titlealts> <shortdesc>You can quickly publish your DITA information to PDF. </shortdesc> <!-- ... --> </task>

fig.title: navtitle in a map
fig.p: In this example, two navtitle elements are used in a DITA map. The first navtitle is not locked; its content simply serves to indicate information about the content of the referenced DITA topic. When the DITA map is published, the navigation title is retrieved from GUID-gibberish.dita. However, the second navtitle is locked, so when the DITA map is published, Publishing to ePub is used for a navigation title.
fig.codeblock: <map xml:lang="en"> <title>Publishing a DITA information set</title> <topicref href="GUID-gibberish.dita"> <topicmeta> <navtitle>Publishing to PDF</navtitle> </topicmeta> </topicref> <topicref href="publishing-ePub.dita" locktitle="yes"> <topicmeta> <navtitle>Publishing to ePub</navtitle> </topicmeta> </topicref> </map>
